required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fetal Myocardial Performance Index in Diabetic Pregnancies
clinical_study.official_title: Fetal Myocardial Performance Index in Diabetic Pregnancies

lead_sponsor.agency: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The myocardial tissue is the most likely structure affected by hyperglycemia. The myocardial performance index (MPI) is a pulsed wave Doppler-derived index of global myocardial function. It is defined as the sum of the isovolumetric contraction time (ICT) and isovolumetric relaxation time (IRT) divided by the ejection time (ET) The fetal right heart contributes more to the cardiac output than the left heart; therefore, it is important to assess the right ventricular function. The investigators will measure right ventricular MPI in diabetic and normal pregnancies.

detailed_description.textblock: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) is the most common metabolic disorder in pregnancy, with an overall prevalence of 3-7 % during pregnancy. The myocardial tissue is the most likely structure affected by hyperglycemia. The myocardial performance index (MPI) is a pulsed wave Doppler-derived index of global myocardial function. It is defined as the sum of the isovolumetric contraction time (ICT) and isovolumetric relaxation time (IRT) divided by the ejection time (ET) The fetal right heart contributes more to the cardiac output than the left heart; therefore, it is important to assess the right ventricular function. The investigators will measure right ventricular MPI in diabetic and normal pregnancies.

primary_outcome.description: cardiac contractility will be measured with Doppler ultrasonography

arm_group.description: Pregnant women with pregestational or gestational diabetes mellitus
Pregnant women without pregestational or gestational diabetes mellitus

intervention.description: fetal right ventricular myocardial performance index measured with tissue doppler

study_pop.textblock: 18-40 years old pregestational or gestational diabetic women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-40 years old pregnant women
Exclusion Criteria:
- fetal cardiac anomalies
- multiple gestations

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Kanuni Sultan Suleyman Training and Research Hospital
